{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3661564,"name":"Elliot S","username":"ElliotS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elliots/{size}/177628_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T19:54:44.236Z","cooked":"

Hi CD, here is my quick rant about about product specs from FRC vendors.

So, specs(specifications), aka the will my part do the thing I want it to do for more that 10 seconds. This is a very important factor in how you decide to use parts and how not use them. Recently I was looking to see what rpm a thunder hex bushing from WCP could handle to see if it would be usable on an end effector. I looked through the product page, the technical drawing, and the user guide to see if I could find it and it was not there. I ended up asking about it on CD and got an answer from the specs of a VEX part that appeared to be the same. But I am not sure even where that spec came from because the product page does not seem to have that info on it.

This contrast other sites you can visit like McMaster-Carr, where you have lots of info for every product, you may think of McMaster as the exception(as it partially is), but many sites you go to have detailed specs on almost every products, here are some examples:

Bushing from McMaster

McMaster-Carr

image451×721 13.1 KB

Bearing from McMaster

McMaster-Carr

image437×633 10.3 KB

Bearing from Bearings Direct

MR115-ZZ Mini Ball Bearing 5x11x4 Shielded R1150ZZ - Bearings Direct

Aluminum Angle from Online Metals

https://www.onlinemetals.com/en/buy/aluminum/0-75-x-0-75-x-0-125-aluminum-angle-6061-t6-extruded-structural/pid/970

image557×669 17 KB

Molex Connector from DigiKey

https://www.digikey.com/en/products/detail/molex/0738380002/4134819
this is a real industrial product so it’s spec sheet is a whole document
https://www.molex.com/content/dam/molex/molex-dot-com/products/automated/en-us/productspecificationpdf/738/73838/PS-73838-005-001.pdf

1/2in Flat Nylon Webbing from Strapworks

https://www.strapworks.com/12-inch-flat-nylon-hot-orange

image968×336 28.2 KB

Mesh Wire Organizer from Amazon

https://www.amazon.com/Electriduct-Hook-Closing-Braided-Sleeving/dp/B08JX392N7

Keep in mind there are also many examples of products without specs, these are just the ones I found with some sort of specs(and not all of these are great examples).

For most of this comparison I have used bearings and bushings. For me the main things I am looking for in bearings and bushing specs are; max RPM, max static load, and max dynamic load. But other specs like tolerances, lubrication status, and bearing trade number if there is one would be nice to have.

The main takeaway and TLDR I want you to have is: FRC vendors need to step up their game with providing specifications for products they sell. Students should learn how to find these resources and use them to make better and more efficient designs that will hold up to real world conditions.

Note: This post it is not meant to specifically mention WCP or VEX, this is a more general problem you can see on many suppliers sites. I am sorry if this comes off as angry or disrespectful. I know from seeing post from these suppliers that they are very small compared to most of the industry and getting these things dialed in is hard on them but these points stand true no mater you company’s size and income.

10 Feet - Orange : Electronics","clicks":3},{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/thunderhex-bushings.html#attr-vex_kit_contents","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"ThunderHex Bushings - VEX Robotics","clicks":3},{"url":"https://www.molex.com/content/dam/molex/molex-dot-com/products/automated/en-us/productspecificationpdf/738/73838/PS-73838-005-001.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.onlinemetals.com/en/buy/aluminum/0-75-x-0-75-x-0-125-aluminum-angle-6061-t6-extruded-structural/pid/970","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1},{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/7804K107/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":1},{"url":"https://www.digikey.com/en/products/detail/molex/0738380002/4134819","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1},{"url":"https://bearingsdirect.com/mr115-zz-mini-ball-bearing-5x11x4-shielded-r1150zz/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MR115-ZZ Mini Ball Bearing 5x11x4 Shielded R1150ZZ - Bearings Direct","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.strapworks.com/12-inch-flat-nylon-hot-orange","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":35}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/1","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":35},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":36,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3661622,"name":"Karl Olson","username":"olsonkarlp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:20:30.275Z","cooked":"

So many times a great opportunity to teach engineering is ruined or at least made much more difficult by this. It is an unfortunate reality of the current state of FRC vendors. I would love to be able to ask students why they choose parts and have the answer be “because it is within the specs and therefore is a good option” rather than “other teams have used this part that has no specs with success, so it will probably work for us too”.

The lack of specs makes even calculating what it would need to be, a great teaching exercise, have little motivation.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T20:20:30.275Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":443,"readers_count":442,"score":333.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Karl Olson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":16}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Technical Mentor | 3476"},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/2","custom_user_title":"Technical Mentor | 3476","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":16,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661624,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:24:58.021Z","cooked":"

It’s not clear what you’re asking for here. I think the status quo is 95% fine?

The McMaster bearings specs are designed for non-technical purchasing agents to match an engineering specification to a broad range of matching components, and the engineering specification should be written broadly enough to allow any component meeting or exceeding it to be approved for purchase and use for lifetimes measured in years. If a purchased part doesn’t meet it’s spec, it will be investigated and the failure remediated at vendors cost, again over years.

The frc vendor standard for mechanical parts of “we used them and they did fine, here’s CAD to 0.002in” is fine* for our market. I don’t want vendors spending thousands of dollars on spec validation. We don’t have a years long remediation mechanism to retrofit FRC robots with bearings that fit the use case. We don’t have a measured and validated load case to write master service agreement contracts and warranties against.

FRC mechanical parts are a hobbyist market full of trust-me-bro-science, sloppy fits and best guesses. Changing that will cost money that I don’t think teams are willing to pay.

*It does lead to fun stuff like hex fits not being universal between vendors (worst in ~2017ish, mostly fixed by going to rounded hex)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T20:27:06.116Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":430,"readers_count":429,"score":256.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661627,"name":"Karl Olson","username":"olsonkarlp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:28:29.832Z","cooked":"

Is it really too much to ask for them to tell us how many strands are in the wire before we buy it? Or what the original manufacturer specs are for the bushings they resell?

I do not wish for extensive testing or investigation, just basic information that makes for educational opportunities. I would prefer teaching engineering, not bro-science.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T20:28:29.832Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":377,"readers_count":376,"score":255.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Karl Olson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28019,"username":"s-neff","name":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Technical Mentor | 3476"},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/4","custom_user_title":"Technical Mentor | 3476","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661628,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:28:54.066Z","cooked":"
olsonkarlp:

"because it is within the specs and therefore is a good option” rather than “other teams have used this part that has no specs with success, so it will probably work for us too”.

There’s a lot of tribal knowledge that could belong in someplace like frcdesign.org, but I wouldn’t want to make vendors directly responsible for.

olsonkarlp:

How many strands are in the wire before we buy it? Or what the original manufacturer specs are for the bushings they resell?

That’s reasonable, and why I asked OP exactly what he was asking for.

I do suspect for many mechanical parts the answer is “it’s brass and dimensions match the cad”

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T23:13:04.042Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":370,"readers_count":369,"score":94.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"http://frcdesign.org","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRCDesign.org","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661632,"name":"Mike Schreiber","username":"Mike_Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_schreiber/{size}/200098_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:40:34.610Z","cooked":"
olsonkarlp:

Or what the original manufacturer specs are for the bushings they resell?

I do not wish for extensive testing or investigation, just basic information that makes for educational opportunities. I would prefer teaching engineering, not bro-science.

For stuff that is being resold it makes sense to repost the factory specs like RPMs on a bearing, or strands count on a wire, but for anything custom made for FRC it’s hard to justify formal specs / validation.

Original specs on a custom bushing designed to run on a rounded hex? Should they include margin for teams to drastically misalign the shaft and then complain that it binds up and doesn’t meet the spec the supplier posted?

The number of times a spec sheet doesn’t have what I need in my day job is significant - what you’re calling bro-science is just part of engineering. “Qualified by similarity” is a real term that is used - discussing the conditions that apply to the original use case and how your usage differs is a valuable exercise.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T20:40:34.610Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":341,"readers_count":340,"score":243.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Mike Schreiber","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7123,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661634,"name":"Karl Olson","username":"olsonkarlp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:42:00.858Z","cooked":"

I think you are reading too much into what I said. I agree with you.

olsonkarlp:

resell

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T20:42:33.040Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":311,"readers_count":310,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Karl Olson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7123,"username":"Mike_Schreiber","name":"Mike Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_schreiber/{size}/200098_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Technical Mentor | 3476"},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/7","custom_user_title":"Technical Mentor | 3476","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661637,"name":"Sam","username":"clydefrog88","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clydefrog88/{size}/150683_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T20:48:19.119Z","cooked":"
Mike_Schreiber:

The number of times a spec sheet doesn’t have what I need in my day job is significant - what you’re calling bro-science is just part of engineering. “Qualified by similarity” is a real term that is used - discussing the conditions that apply to the original use case and how your usage differs is a valuable exercise.

Oh man this hits home.

An anecdote for those not in this world: A couple of months ago I was trying to specify a sluice gate valve for a client’s purchase and inclusion into our design. The vendor had an incomplete catalog drawing with schematically shown options. When pressed for more dimensions, crickets. This was a ~$80k valve. Compare that the capital environment of FRC.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T20:51:53.208Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":302,"readers_count":301,"score":180.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661682,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T21:34:49.136Z","cooked":"

I’ve got to say, without some actual testing, coming up with any form of load or speed rating for round corner hex in a metal bushing is going to be hard! With round shaft in round holes you can dig up some actual load ratings and with actual oil involved you can calculate where the shaft lifts off and floats on the oil film. This sort of stuff uses PV (pressure times velocity) ratings and some fairly hand-wavey calculations anyway. Plus, for plastic bearings the durn things swell with heat and water… With round corner hex you aren’t ever going to get liftoff. The loaded zone is skinny, mis-alignment is going to make things even weirder, and the list goes on…

Sorry, my inner engineer is barely concealed

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T21:34:49.136Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":193.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661731,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-23T22:05:47.282Z","cooked":"

Yeah, even if there were published specs, actual performance in any given application may not match up. I had consulting project once where a automation company was having bearing failures on one of their products. They had tried a bunch of different suppliers, including all the most expensive name brands, before giving up and spending thousands on outside consultants. All the math we could come up with showed that those bearing should have been fine, but switching them out with slightly larger ones fixed everything.

FRC is not at all representative of normal use for these sorts of products. FRC bots see very high vibrations, often very poor build quality and assembly practices and the service life of an FRC bot is extremely short. The specs you find on McMaster or those other websites are based on conditions totally unlike ours and shouldn’t be trusted much anyway.

Patrick3357:

The specs you find on McMaster or those other websites are based on conditions totally unlike ours and shouldn’t be trusted much anyway.

Very much this. If you look at Gates’ official load ratings for HTD 5mm belts, for example, you’ll find that we routinely use them out-of-spec (by a factor of two or so!) in FRC.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-23T22:13:29.752Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":229,"readers_count":228,"score":180.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503549,"topic_slug":"a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/a-quick-rant-about-product-specs-from-frc-vendors/503549/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3661845,"name":"Matt Carroll","username":"MCarroll94","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mcarroll94/{size}/158582_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-24T00:12:09.217Z","cooked":"

The bearing from McMaster is $7.50 and the WCP equivalent is $2.00. I’m going to give FRC vendors a break if they don’t have all the engineering specs listed on their product pages that other sites; like McMaster have posted. If I can get a product for a fraction of the price and similar quality, I’ll spend some time digging and find a rough equivalent of what the product can probably handle.
